case_title: CITY DRY FISH COMPANY vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX
complaint_summary: The appellant, a partnership firm, filed a return for the assessment year 1980-81 declaring income supported by books of account. A search under section 132 revealed discrepancies, leading to a revised return and disputes over reserve amounts.
investigation_summary: A notebook recovered during a search indicated income discrepancies. The Income-tax Officer added Rs.85,622 to the income, claiming it was not previously taxed. The Tribunal later remitted the case for further examination of profit-sharing ratios among retired partners.
judgment_summary: The court set aside the Tribunal's decision to club Rs.85,622 as income for the assessment year 1980-81. It directed the Income-tax Officer to ascertain the profit-sharing ratios of outgoing partners and pass fresh orders.
punishment: No penalty imposed; levy of penalty on Rs.85,622 set aside.
Decision_or_verdict: Order accordingly; case remitted to Income-tax Officer for further examination.
legal_arguments: Section 256(2) of the Income Tax Act, 1961 invoked by the appellant.
Dispute over Rs.85,622 reserve amount and its taxability.

legal_terms.Income Tax Return: A document filed with the tax authorities declaring income and tax obligations.
legal_terms.Reserve: Funds set aside for specific purposes, often untaxed.

words_and_phrases.Profit-sharing ratio: The proportion of profits allocated to partners in a firm.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a dispute over the taxability of reserve funds and discrepancies in income declarations. The court remitted the matter to the Income-tax Officer for detailed examination of profit-sharing ratios among retired partners.
